{{flavour|A fearsome weapon with a forked, razor-sharp blade.}}

{{crawlquote|This weapon falls into the [[Long Blades]] category. It is a one handed weapon.}}

Despite its ridiculous concept, the rare '''double sword''' is a desirable weapon for any Long Blades user looking to wear a [[shield]]. It has roughly the same stats as an [[eveningstar]], though Long Blades scale with [[dexterity]] rather than [[strength]].

Unlike the [[demon blade]], the double sword is two-handed for [[Kobold]]s and [[Spriggan]]s.

==Strategy==
===Compared to demon blades===
On most species, [[demon blade]]s are mostly equivalent to double swords. If both weapons are at minimum delay, a +0 demon blade is 1% stronger than a +0 double sword against a 0 AC opponent. As the demon blade attacks faster, it is penalized more by [[AC]], though it benefits more from [[slaying]] and [[auxiliary attack]]s. 

Overall, the differences are too small to make an impact. A +9 demon blade is enough to win you the game, as is a +9 double sword. Generally, the sword you get ''first'' should be the sword that you use. (The sword you get first can benefit first from [[scrolls of enchant weapon]]).

For smaller species, the demon blade will usually come out ahead, because it does not use the shield slot.

==History==
*Double swords had [[riposte]] and 14 base damage in [[0.19]], then back to 15 damage and no riposte in [[0.28]].
*Double swords were renamed to [[bastard sword]]s in [[0.14]], then back to double swords in [[0.16]].
